intro: Taraxacum cordatifrons, commonly known as the heartleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces a yellow flower that develops into a fluffy white seed head, typical of the dandelion genus. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are typically basal, with a distinctive cordate shape, and the plant is often found in moist or well-drained soils.
